message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Statin medication works by inhibiting HMG-CoA reductase, which is involved in cholesterol synthesis. The major apolipoprotein found on the lipoprotein most directly affected by statin medication is Apolipoprotein B-100, which is found on LDL cholesterol particles.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atorvastatin is a statin medication that primarily targets LDL cholesterol. LDL particles primarily contain apolipoprotein B-100, making it the major apolipoprotein found on the lipoprotein most directly affected by atorvastatin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Statins directly affect LDL cholesterol, which is composed mainly of apolipoprotein B-100. Apolipoprotein A-I is found on HDL cholesterol, while apolipoprotein B-48 is found on chylomicrons and apolipoprotein C-II is found on VLDL and chylomicrons.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atorvastatin is a lipid-lowering medication that primarily affects LDL cholesterol levels, which contain Apolipoprotein B-100. A and B-48 are found on chylomicrons, while C-II is found on VLDL and chylomicrons.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atorvastatin targets LDL cholesterol, which is composed primarily of Apolipoprotein B-100. Therefore, the correct answer is (C). It is important to note that while other apolipoproteins may be present on LDL cholesterol, Apolipoprotein B-100 is the most abundant and targeted by statin medications.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atorvastatin targets low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, which contains apolipoprotein B-100 as its major protein component. Apolipoprotein A-I is found on high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, apolipoprotein B-48 is found on chylomicrons, and apolipoprotein C-II is found on very low-density lipoprotein (VLDL) cholesterol.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Apolipoprotein B-100 is the major apolipoprotein found on LDL (low-density lipoprotein) cholesterol, which is the lipoprotein most directly affected by statin medication. Apolipoprotein A-I is found on HDL (high-density lipoprotein) cholesterol, Apolipoprotein B-48 is found on chylomicrons and remnants, and Apolipoprotein C-II is found on VLDL (very-low-density lipoprotein) and chylomicrons.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atorvastatin is a statin medication that directly affects LDL cholesterol, which contains Apolipoprotein B-100. Apolipoprotein A-I is mainly found on HDL cholesterol. Apolipoprotein B-48 is mainly found on chylomicrons and Apolipoprotein C-II is mainly found on VLDL and chylomicrons.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atorvastatin is a medication that primarily reduces low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, which contains apolipoprotein B-100. Apolipoprotein A-I is a major component of high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol. Apolipoprotein B-48 is found on chylomicrons, which are not directly affected by atorvastatin. Apolipoprotein C-II is involved in the lipoprotein lipase pathway, which is not directly affected by atorvastatin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Apolipoprotein B-100 is the major apolipoprotein found on LDL particles, the lipoprotein most directly affected by statin medications. Apolipoprotein A-I is found on HDL particles, while Apolipoprotein B-48 is found on chylomicrons and Apolipoprotein C-II is found on VLDL and chylomicron remnants.
